history.text: hi there!
Howdy!

Catch Me if You Can is an amazing movie
! Rotten Tomatoes seems to agree!
Yeah i think so too, but i think it should have gotten a better score.
Well it ended pretty slow and seemed to drag on after a while.
I think the story is fascinating, how a 19 year old kid could do so much
And its even a true story!
Too bad he used his great mind to commit crimes
Leonardo DiCaprio and Tom Hanks were just amazing!
True, but he did end up helping catch check forgers at the end
Yes, it was one of the best acting jobs of DiCaprio in my opinion.
Absolutely. And Tom Hanks, always a solid performer! I wonder why it took until 2002 to make a movie about this story.
Frank had a though time with his parents, he had to endure their divorce.
Steven Spielberg did an amazing job directing.
He had the need of money, since he lived in a wealthy family and suddenly had to adapt to living in a small apartment, so i guess that's what motivated him to do what he did.
Yes, Steven Spielberg as always, making great movies
And his mother's affair had to be difficult
One of my favorite scenes is when Frank Jr. first poses as an airline pilot.
Oh yeah, the way he fooled the cops on that moment, hilarious
Its a nail-biter when he escapes off of the plane!
But like most of the times, the evil doers have to fall, and this one wasn't going to escape.
It was his decision tho, if he wanted he could have gone somewhere else, but he couldn
he couldn't accept what his mother did.
I believe he saw Carl as a father figure
Desperation started him on his journey, but his wits and fondness for the deception made him excel
I like the ending. I wonder if that's how the story ends in real life
Amy adams was good in this too.
In the beginning, you want to dislike Carl, but he turns out to be a pretty great guy under that tough facade
The amount of money Frank Jr. ended up stealing and producing is astounding. And that is all in 1960's and 1970's money!
Can't deny the real talent and guts this guy had!
There are several funny moments in the movie, and just as many moments that put you on the edge of your seat. What a ride!
